definition:
1. Dull; dusky; somewhat dark; gloomy; as, a somber forest; a somber house. 2. Melancholy; sad; grave; depressing; as, a somber person; somber reflections. The dinner was silent and somber; happily it was also short. Beaconsfield.

To make somber, or dark; to make shady. [R.]

Gloom; obscurity; duskiness; somberness. [Obs.]
